meanings.definition: The act of vilifying or defaming someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant vilification of her classmates made them feel sad.
meanings.sent2: The vilification of the politician in the media was relentless.
meanings.sent3: The vilification of the broccoli in the cafeteria was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The vilification of the old building as an eyesore was unfair.
meanings.sent5: The vilification of the villain in the story made him a memorable character.

meanings.definition: The state of being vilified or defamed.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity faced vilification from the tabloids after the scandal.
meanings.sent2: Living in constant vilification can take a toll on one's mental health.
meanings.sent3: The cake's vilification as too sweet was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The vilification of the forest as haunted added to its mysterious allure.
meanings.sent5: The vilification of the team's performance was heard throughout the stadium.
